--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Mike Clark <mike@c...> wrote:

> Indeed, I did.  And I thought it was very cool that you invited some 
> developers of JUnit extensions and such to contribute to the book.

I figured that the creator were the best people to describe them.  The
hard part was selecting which ones.  What blew me away was how quickly
everyone I asked said "You bet, when do you need it?".

In the same vein, I have Bryan Dollary extolling the virtues of IDEA
for TDD work (while I make the case for Eclipse), James Newkirk on
NUnit (and if you're sing C# & NUnit, watch for James' upcoming book
on the subject), Kay Pentecost on VBUnit, and a writeup on Agile
Modeling by Scott Ambler.

> But  I'd still be gushing about the book if I wasn't a contributor. 
> It all pays the same.  :-)

"Fame & glory, kid... Fame & Glory" (Indiana Jones & The Temple of Doom)

Dave
